definition: surname Yin/abbr. for 印度[Yin4 du4]
to print/to mark/to engrave/a seal/a print/a stamp/a mark/a trace/image
to brush/to paint/to daub/to paste up/to skip class (of students)/to fire from a job
line of business/industry/occupation/job/employment/school studies/enterprise/property/(Buddhism) karma/deed/to engage in/already

sentences.english: To supervise the management of printing industry.
It has been implicated in the Reformation, the Renaissance and the Scientific Revolution.
sentences.chinese: 文藝復新時期和科學時期帶動了印刷業的改革。

sentences.english: Suitable for measuring blankets & rollers in the graphic arts industry.
sentences.chinese: 適合測量印刷業使用的膠布及墨輥之硬度。

sentences.english: He was a printer by trade and naturalist by avocation.
sentences.chinese: 他從事印刷業，同時是個博物學愛好者。

sentences.english: He saved Fleet Street by crushing the print unions.
sentences.chinese: 他打敗了印刷業聯盟從而挽救了英國倫敦傳媒界。

sentences.english: He had, it appears, been for three months apprenticed to a printer.
sentences.chinese: 據說他當過三個月的印刷業學徒。

sentences.english: She has been credited with being a pioneer in the “green” printing industry.
sentences.chinese: 都說她被譽爲是綠色印刷業的先驅。

definition: to praise the virtue of sb or sth while concealing their faults
